Physical Exam: Neurological examination: Assess mental status, cranial nerves, motor function, sensation, reflexes, and coordination.
Justification: To assess for any neurological deficits or injuries.

Physical Exam: Musculoskeletal examination: Assess range of motion, tenderness, swelling, and stability of the right arm and shoulder.
Justification: To assess for any musculoskeletal injuries or pain.

Physical Exam: Head examination: Assess for any signs of scalp lacerations, bruising, or swelling.  Check for any signs of cerebrospinal fluid leakage from the ears or nose.
Justification: To assess for any signs of head injury or concussion.

Physical Exam: Balance and gait assessment: Assess for any signs of dizziness, vertigo, or balance problems.  Observe gait and coordination.
Justification: To assess for any signs of dizziness or balance problems.
